title: Faced with an armada of EU and Remainer ineptitude, Boris is the luckiest general in history
text:
Napoleon Bonaparte, when considering promoting an officer who had been recommended to him, famously said “I know he’s a good general, but is he lucky?” For the notoriously superstitious Emperor, a commander must have fate on their side.

When surveying the myriad forces that have arrayed themselves against Boris Johnson, both at home and abroad, one cannot escape the conclusion that he is the most charmed general who has ever taken the field in political warfare.

Whether he gets his new deal through Parliament this week or not, his opponents’ catastrophic blunders, overreaching, and self-marginalisation are now coming into even starker relief. The Liberal Democrats ‘Charge of the Light Brigade’...
description: Napoleon Bonaparte, when considering promoting an officer who had been recommended to him, famously said “I know he’s a good general, but is he lucky?
